page.title: 15Architecture part 2
page.content: The presence of a number of wealthy country houses in the village is probably explained by the fact that the principal Manor in Much Hadham belonged to the Bishops of London from before the Norman Conquest until 1888, when it was sold by the Ecclesiastical Commissioners. Just where the River Ash bends round Bush Hill is The Palace.Here began the Tudor Dynasty,for Henry V's widow gave birth in this place to Edmund Tudor,whose son Harry won the throne on Bosworth Field.The building has changed since then and today it is mainly 16th century,with an outer casing of 17th century brick. A floor cuts in half the fine old hall with its gabled windows and mighty oak girders but there is an elegant staircase and 17th century panelling.
